resource.name: ITD Application and Enterprise Availability
resource.description: Zabbix, an open-source monitoring software tool, is reporting the availability of applications and infrastructure.  Applications include Advantage, CIS, Kronos, Accela, Judicial Services, GIS, CMMS, and more. It is a roll up of 91 monitors.  Infrastructure reports the enterprise platforms, which includes server, storage, network, IVR/ACD and UC platforms. It is a roll up of 57 monitors. The monitors include scheduled down time, which includes scheduled maintenance and upgrades.  It also includes the routine downtime for Advantage The available time is converted to a percentage rounded to four 9s.  The data set is coming from on ITD dashboard that is currently pulling the monitors’ data from Zabbix.
columns_description: Shown as either the amount of monitors included in this score if the score is due to a rollup or the amount of downtime in a particular amount of days if individual monitor
The name of the set in the ITD dashboard
The date the monitor started tracking availability
The ID for set in the ITD dashboard
The date the monitor stopped tracking availability
Unique Row Identifier
Which of the two metrics does this information belong
The available time converted to a percentage
Which month was this score taken
Which fiscal year was this score taken

resource.name: Solid Waste - Barrels Collected
resource.description: Summarized statistics used for performance measures and describes scheduled and collected curbside trash including black, blue and green barrels.  Black barrels are considered regular trash destined for landfill. Green barrels are for recycling of green yard waste. Blue barrels are for recycling of paper, some plastics, glass and metal cans.
columns_description: Unique row identifier
Year the barrels were scheduled and collected
Month the barrels were scheduled and collected
Date period the barrels were scheduled and collected
Type of barrel such as green waste (green), recycle (blue) and trash (black)
Number of black, blue and green barrels actually collected during the time period
Number barrels reported as missed by the customer and not picked up during the time period. This number is not verified

resource.name: Total Employees and Businesses
resource.description:
The Total Employees and Businesses Dataset is a snapshot of the total number of businesses that are currently in Mesa, as well as the total number of employees that work in Mesa. 
Source: ESRI Community Analyst. 
It is important to note that in this dataset, a “Full-Time Employee (FTE)” in Mesa is someone who may not necessarily live in Mesa, however, they are employed at a business that is located in Mesa. This is a distinct difference between the “Employment” number in Mesa, which is stated in the “Employment Dataset.” Employment refers to the total number of Mesa residents that are employed, within or outside of the City of Mesa.
columns_description: Year formatted as date
Business, Employee or Population Count
Indicates whether measure is for a Business, Employee or Population
Name of City
Year of Measurement

resource.name: Canal Centerline
resource.description: This data set contains the location of the center line of canals that run through the City of Mesa, the jurisdiction each segment falls within, the owner/maintenance provider of the canal and the name of the canal.This data set provides information regarding the location, jurisdiction, owner and name of the canals that bisect or exist within the City of Mesa. Updated as changes are made to the canal alignments
columns_description: Name of canal segment
Owner of canal segment. MC=Maricopa County; COM=City of Mesa; SRP=Salt River Project; BLM=Bureau of Land Management; RWCD=Roosevelt Water Conservation District
Location of canal segment

resource.name: Business Services - Faulty Utility Meters
resource.description: This dataset contains the number of faulty meters (gas, water, electric) that are detected each month and how many of those meters had been faulty for 3 months or less. A faulty meter is one that is not registering the usage correctly.

The numbers of meters found that were not registering usage correctly.
Month name only

The total number of months back billed / the number of meters back billed, rounded to the whole number since billing is monthly. The total number of months back billed / the number of meters back billed, rounded to the whole number since billing is monthly.
Of the meters found that were not registering correctly, the number that had been faulty for 3 months or less.

resource.name: Feeding Mesa - City of Mesa Food Drive
resource.description: This dataset details the locations of, and pounds received at fourteen canned food drives throughout the City of Mesa as part of the Mesa Cares Feeding Mesa Program.  Food drives were conducted by City of Mesa Staff and volunteers.  Food received was distributed to United Food Bank and/or Midwest Food Bank for distribution to their constituent agencies. More information about Feeding Mesa program is available at https://www.mesaaz.gov/government/mesa-cares/feeding-mesa
columns_description: Actual date of collection
Date of the first Monday of the week when the collection happened
Food collected was delivered to United Food Bank and/or Midwest Food Bank for distribution to their constituents
Month name of first Monday of collection
Number of pounds collected at each location
Month of collection
Location where food collection drive took place at six (6) geographically distinct locations throughout City of Mesa
Year of first Monday when collection occurred
Year of collection
